intro: Ilex dubia f. genuina, commonly known as the Mexican holly, is a shrub or small tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are glossy and typically elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
